results.title: Kemira: diary of a strike
results.brief_description: The first Australian film to document the organisation of a strike and its unfolding over time from an “insider” perspective. In September 1982, at the height of the economic recession, Australian Iron and Steel, a subsidiary of BHP, announced its intention to retrench 400 miners from the six coal pits which supplied the company’s Wollongong steelworks. Kemira was the worst affected pit where 206 workers (two-thirds of the workforce) were to lose their jobs. A confronting account of an important historical and political event.

results.title: Kelvin and his friends
results.creator_credit: Brian McKenzie, John Cruthers, Australian Film Commission, Brian McKenzie Film Productions and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: A closely observed portrait of a single man in his 40’s who lives in St Kilda. Although he has none of the trappings of conventional existence, Kelvin’s obsessive interest in Born Again Christianity, physical culture and recent German/Jewish history has given him a way of making sense of the world and led him to a number of people, friends through whom we see something of his life and beliefs. These friends include Anna and Max Wachtel, Neil Taylor, Egan and Margaret. The film was made between February 1983 and June 1987 in Melbourne. Camera: Brian McKenzie, Ray Argall.

results.title: Kelly film
results.creator_credit: Stephen Radic, John Bird and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A short musical, with songs in the style of Gilbert and Sullivan and early Australian folk, about a bank clerk who believes himself to be Ned Kelly. Stars Peter O’Shea, Howard Stanley and Jude Hewitson. Songs written and performed by Stephen Radic.

results.title: Kellie McGregor: animation
results.brief_description: Freak Magnet: the narrator is one unlucky individual - as is evident as she recounts her experience of meeting freaks and wackos in movie theatres, as housemates, and at the train station. Written produced and narrated by Kellie McGregor. Advertisements for yogo dairy snack and the dog food schmakos as animated by Kellie McGregor accompany the first short. Note: Individual titles are listed on the cover as ‘Freak magnet’, ‘Flying gherkin’ and ‘Commercial history’.

results.title: Keeping your teeth healthy
results.creator_credit: Hugh Johnston, Suzanne Johnston and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A positive approach to the care of teeth, noting the functions of the different kinds of teeth and the role of nutrition in keeping teeth healthy. Stresses the need for regular dental care and visits to the dentist.

results.title: Keeping up with the Joneses
results.creator_credit: Rob Brow, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Rob Brow Productions
results.brief_description: Nancy and Jonah Jones live on the Mallee Track. He is a pig-breeder and producer and she is a mother of four young children. They are heavily involved in various arts for children and adults in a culturyally isoldated area. Deals with their busy lives as farmers, parents, teachers and art consultants.

results.title: Keeping time
results.creator_credit: Peter Roberts, Sirkka Konttinen, Lorna Powell and Amber Collective
results.brief_description: Integrates documentary footage and dramatised sequences in dealing with mother and daughter relationships. Particular reference is given to the influence of television on the family structure and shows how the mothers want their daughters to better themselves through the local dance studio.

results.title: Keeping electricity safe outside the home
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Kingcroft Productions and Sydney County Council
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
A film made to show children the way to avoid the dangers of electic light wires out-of-doors. A linesman explains to children why it is dangerous to touch electric light wires and advises what to do if a broken wire is found. Shows how wires may be broken by kites and footballs. Warns of the danger of contact with wires touching trees and of contact with wires on the roof of a house.

results.title: Keeping electricity safe inside the home
results.creator_credit: Jean Halliday, Lex Halliday, Australian Instructional Films and Sydney County Council
results.brief_description: Informative study of all the checks that should be made on day to day use of electrical equipment in the home (irons, toasters etc) and precautions to be taken with a general knowledge of electrical operation and illustrated details.
